Class ComputerPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
      • ComputerPlayer

  • public class ComputerPlayer
extends Player
    This class specifies the Computer player. it extends from the Player class and implements the abstract move method to specify how a computer player moves in a tic tac toe game.
    Author:
    Teagen Kiel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Random randomGenerator
      This variable will hold the random generator used to compute a random row and column index to move with

    • Constructor Detail

      • ComputerPlayer

        public ComputerPlayer(java.lang.String name)
        This constructor will ustilize the super constructor to initialize the variables needed
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the player

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public int[] move(Player otherPlayer)
        This method implements the move method to be specific to the computer player type. It will pick two random numbers between 0 and 2 to act as coordinates for its next move. In takes the other player as an argument to make sure it won't pick a spot that is already occupied.
        Specified by:
        move in class Player
        Parameters:
        otherPlayer - the player who is currently not in turn
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the node computed by the method
